title: Processes - Area between Curves - Functions of y

content.description: Let <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the region in the first quadrant bounded above by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 1 plus 4 x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and below by the graph of <math alttext="y equals, 3 to the x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to x, less than or equal to 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following definite integrals gives the area of region <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>R</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?
content.question: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, 1 plus 4 x, minus 3 to the x power, close parenthesis, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator, the natural log of y, and denominator, the natural log of 3, end fraction, minus, the fraction with numerator y minus 1, and denominator 4, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="the integral from, 1 to 9, of, open parenthesis, the fraction with numerator, the natural log of y, and denominator, the natural log of 3, end fraction, minus, the fraction with numerator y minus 1, and denominator 4, close parenthesis, d y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.5: Finding the Area Between Curves Expressed as Functions of y

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
